experiment.name: Transcription profiling by array of Arabidopsis mutant for agl15 and agl18 or overexpressing AGL15 during somatic embryogenesis

description.text: Transcript accumulation was measured using the Affymetrix Arabidopsis ATH1 Genome Array [ATH1-121501] to document changes in response to the MADS-domain transcription factor AGAMOUS-Like 15 during somatic embryogenesis. A somatic embryo system was used where mature seed is allowed to complete germination in liquid MS media containing 2,4-D and seedlings produce somatic embryos from the shoot apical meristem (SAM) region. The frequency with which these embryos are produced directly correlates with AGL15 accumulation. Experiment Overall Design: Wild type Arabidopsis (Columbia ecotype) with normal amounts of AGL15 were compared to (1) 35S:AGL15 that constitutively expresses AGL15 and produces more somatic embryos from the shoot apical region than wild type and (2) agl15 agl18 double loss-of-function mutants that produce less somatic embryos from the shoot apical region than wild type.

bibliography.authors: Zheng Y, Ren N, Wang H, Stromberg AJ, Perry SE
bibliography.title: Global identification of targets of the Arabidopsis MADS domain protein AGAMOUS-Like15.
